gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.TwoD.Contour
Class ContourChangeHandler

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.TwoD.Contour.ContourChangeHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
PropertyChangeHandler, IPreserveState
Direct Known Subclasses:
ContourColorScaleHandler, ContourControlHandler, ContourLayoutHandler, ContourMenuHandler
public abstract class ContourChangeHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements PropertyChangeHandler, IPreserveState

This class defines the basic functionality that any module of a ContourViewComponent should implement. It defines methods that should be invoked when any property has changed. It also defines methods that are invoked when a property has changed. This class implements empty methods for this latter case. Subclasses should override these methods to perform custom work when a property has changed.

                            InformationCenter center,

center - Used to access shared information between other ContourChangeHandlers.
contourPanel - This is panel that renders the contour plot.

colorScaleNameChanged

public final void colorScaleNameChanged(java.lang.String colorscale)
Invoke this method if the colorscale used to color the contour plot has changed.

Parameters:
colorscale - The new colorscale that is being used to color the contour plot.

colorChanged

public final void colorChanged(java.awt.Color color)
Invoke this method if the color used to color the contour lines has changed.

Parameters:
color - The new color of the contour lines on the contour plot.

isDoubleSidedChanged

public final void isDoubleSidedChanged(boolean isDoubleSided)
Invoke this method if the state of whether or not the colorscale used to color the contour plot has changed to or from being double-sided.

Parameters:
isDoubleSided - True if the colorscale is now double-sided and false if it is not. See changeIsDoubleSided() for a description of the results of having the colorscale double-sided or not.

preserveAspectRatioChanged

public final void preserveAspectRatioChanged(boolean preserve)
Invoke this method if the state of whether or not the aspect ratio is preserved when plotting the contour plot has changed.

Parameters:
preserve - True if the aspect ratio should be preserved when plotting the contour plot and false if it shouldn't.

changeColorScaleName

public void changeColorScaleName(java.lang.String colorscale)
This method is invoked to change the colorscale used when plotting the contour plot. This method's implementation is empty. Subclasses should override it to perform specialty work if needed.

Parameters:
colorscale - The new colorscale to use when coloring the contour plot.

changeColor

public void changeColor(java.awt.Color color)
This method is invoked to change the line color used to when plotting the contour plot. This method's implementation is empty. Subclasses should override it to perform specialty work if needed.

Parameters:
color - The new line color to use when coloring the contour plot.

changeIsDoubleSided

public void changeIsDoubleSided(boolean isDoubleSided)
This method is invoked to change if the colorscale used for plotting the contour plot should be double sided or not. This method's implementation is empty. Subclasses should override it to perform specialty work if needed.

Parameters:
isDoubleSided - True if the colorscale used to color the contour plot should be double-sided and false if it shouldn't be. Let x represent the elevation of a contour level. If the colorscale is not double-sided, a contour level at the elevation -x will be colored the same as a contour level at the elevation x. If the colorscale is double-sided, each contour level would be given its own unique color.

changeColorScaleLocation

public void changeColorScaleLocation(java.lang.String location)
This method is invoked to change the location of the colorscale's control on the GUI. This method's implementation is empty. Subclasses should override it to perform specialty work if needed.

Parameters:
location - A key for the location of the colorscale's control.
See Also:
CONTROL_PANEL_LOCATION, BELOW_IMAGE_LOCATION, RIGHT_IMAGE_LOCATION, NONE_LOCATION

changeIntensity

public void changeIntensity(double intensity)
This method is invoked to change the intensity of the color on the colorscale that is used when plotting the contour plot. This method's implementation is empty. Subclasses should override it to perform specialty work if needed.

Parameters:
intensity - The colorscale's new intensity.

changeDisplay

public void changeDisplay()
This method is invoked to change (i.e. update) the display of the contour plot. This method's implementation is empty. Subclasses should override it to perform specialty work if needed.

changeAspectRatio

public void changeAspectRatio(boolean preserve)
This method is invoked to change if the contour plot should have its aspect ratio preserved when it is rendered. This method's implementation is empty. Subclasses should override it to perform specialty work if needed.

Parameters:
preserve - True if the aspect ratio should be preseved and false if it shouldn't be.

reinit

public abstract void reinit(IVirtualArray2D v2d)
This method is invoked whenever the data that is being plotted has changed. Subclasses should perform any changes to adjust for the new data.

Parameters:
v2d - The new data that is going to be plotted.

propertyChanged

public void propertyChanged(java.lang.String property,
                            java.lang.Object value)
This method is invoked whenever a property has changed. Convience methods have been created for each particular property. These methods simply invoke this method with the appropriate property parameter.

Specified by:
propertyChanged in interface PropertyChangeHandler
Parameters:
property - An alias for the property that has changed.
value - The property's new value.
